original_title: Wagner mercenaries take control of military town in Russia
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Mercenary group Wagner, which has been taking part in Russia’s invasion in Ukraine has taken over a town with a military complex in Southern Russia, media reports said while President Vladimir Putin called the move an act of treason.
Wagner Chief Yevgeny Prigozhin has had uneasy relations with Russian military top bras and has complained of heavy losses and inadequate supplies in the war with Ukraine.
The mercenaries have taken control of Rustov-on-don which has military complexes and arms depots with apparently little resistance from the Russian military, reports said.
Wagner mercenaries have been fighting some of the heaviest battles in Ukraine including the bloody confrontations in Bakhmut, a city in eastern Ukraine.
Prigozhin in a social media post claimed Russian forces had attacked and killed his men in Ukraine.
Security in Moscow has been tightened, amid reports that a Wagner armed column was moving towards the city.
The sudden mercenary uprising comes at Ukraine has launched a long awaited ‘counter offensive’ on Russian lines in occupied territories. (Colombo/June24/2023)
